title: ‘100 Liters of Gold’ Review: A Darkly Comic Ode to Finland’s Ancient Homebrew
summary: With an endearing black comedy set in the provinces, which adopts the visual style of a ’60s Western, prolific writer-director Teemu Nikki salutes his country’s (and his family’s) tradition of sahti-making. “100 Liters of Gold” follows two dysfunctional middle-aged sisters, third-generation makers …
